news_header: A man was fined €200 for using loudspeaker on a call at a French train station and is contesting the penalty.
news_original_title: Man launches fight against fine for loudspeaker call at French station
news_text: David, a 54-year-old man, was fined €200 at Nantes station in France for making a call on loudspeaker. Initially told he would be fined €150, the amount increased when he did not pay immediately. SNCF, the railway company, confirmed the fine and stated that their security staff are authorized to issue such penalties. Although there is no national law against loudspeaker use in public, noise regulations exist. Public opinion generally disapproves of loud phone conversations, leading to various policies in different countries regarding phone use on public transport.
